intro: Rubus apiculatus subsp. glaucovirens, commonly known as the glaucous raspberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and trifoliate leaves with a distinctive bluish-white underside. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
